intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron tomentosum, commonly known as the woolly elaeodendron, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, or tomentose, leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Elaeodendron tomentosum is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
